alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Stillwater; Sweet Grass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 30 at 9:39PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM MDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of south central Montana, including the following counties, Carbon, Stillwater and Sweet Grass. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 926 PM MDT, local law enforcement reported that a few roads have become impassible due to flooding in the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. An additional quarter to half inch of rainfall is expected through Tuesday morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Absarokee, Dean, Fishtail, Nye, Roscoe, Reed Point, Greycliff, Luther, Cooney Reservoir State Park, Fox, Roberts and Mc Leod. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
